Frage 1
elements.title: The line chart represents .... The axes represent ... on the one hand and ... on the other.
elements.correctAnswer: The line chart shows three different taxation variants. The axes represent income tax on the one hand and income on the other.

elements.title: Now it's time to understand the graphic (OVI). To do this, check each of the following statements.

elements.name: question2
Frage 2
rows: 1 According to the diagram, the tax amount for the poll tax is always the same regardless of income.
2. if your income is CHF 40,000, you pay CHF 16,000 in income tax; if your income is CHF 120,000, you also pay CHF 16,000.
elements.title: Statements on the dark green line:

elements.name: Frage 3
rows: 3. if you earn CHF 40,000 a year, you pay CHF 8,000 in a proportional tax system, according to the diagram. If you earn twice as much, you pay three times as much.
4 In a proportional tax system, the top-earning household pays more than CHF 20,000 in income tax per year.
elements.title: Statements on the light green line:

elements.name: Frage 4
rows: 5 According to the chart, in a progressive tax system, the tax amounts for low and high earners are the furthest apart.
6 In a progressive tax system, the amount of tax increases regularly with income.
elements.title: Statements on the orange line:

elements.name: Frage 5
elements.title: Rephrase the false statements so that they are correct:
elements.correctAnswer:
(3) If you earn CHF 40,000 a year, you pay CHF 8,000 in a proportional tax system, according to the diagram. If you earn twice as much, you also pay twice as much.
(5) In a progressive tax system, the tax amount does not increase regularly with income, but progressively (= disproportionately), the curve becomes steeper at high incomes.

elements.name: question3
question7
elements.title: Compare the three types of tax with each other. Formulate at least three statements. Use the phrases in the box:
elements.defaultValue: Beispiel: Bei einem Kopfsteuersystem bezahlen die Einkommensschwächsten prozentual am meisten Steuern, nämlich genau 40% ihres Jahreseinkommens.
elements.correctAnswer:
1. the tax burden for low incomes is lowest with the progressive variant, higher with the proportional variant and highest with the capitation tax variant.
2. In percentage terms, the highest earners pay the most with the progressive tax.
3. With a proportional tax system, the percentage of income spent on taxes is the same for all incomes.
4. In contrast to the poll tax, the amount of tax increases with rising income in the other two tax variants.
